revised_title: A Firsthand Account of the September 30, 1750 Earthquake
tldr: In a letter to Mr. James Ayschough, Henry Green describes the experience of the September 30, 1750 earthquake that shook the United Kingdom. He recounts the shaking and rolling noise, damage to buildings, and how the earthquake affected people in different locations. The event was felt over a 30 to 40-mile radius, and Green estimates its duration to be around 20 seconds.
